creator: m.wallner@iworks.at
text:
SHA passwords worked with 2.0.43 but do not with 2.0.44

w:\>htpasswd -b /www/test/sha/.htu mike 123
Automatically using MD5 format.
Updating password for user mike

=> access gained

w:\>htpasswd -bs /www/test/sha/.htu mike 123
Updating password for user mike

=> authentication fails

Apache 2.0.44 on Windows 2000 SP2
w:\>apache -V
Server version: Apache/2.0.44
Server built:   Jan 18 2003 11:47:09
Server's Module Magic Number: 20020903:0
Architecture:   32-bit
...

So, a bug?

Michael

I get the same result using:
Red Hat Linux release 7.3 (Valhalla)
httpd-2.0.46

passwords generated without sha encryption (htpasswd -s) work just fine, but sha
encrypted passwords don't allow access...

Is anybody looking into this issue or does anybody have a workaround?...

Thanks,

Vin
creator: vin@tivo.com
felicity@kluge.net
text:
I just upgraded from 1.3.x to 2.0.48 and have the same problem.  Authentication that used to work fine 
with SHA1 passwords no longer function.  If I shift to MD5 or normal crypt() it works fine.

Thanks for the reports.  This is fixed for the next release; you can get the
patch from here meanwhile:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/apr-util/crypto/apr_md5.c?r1=1.7.2.1&r2=1.7.2.2
